snippet: As “The Greatest Grid: The Master Plan of Manhattan, 1811-2011” at the Museum of the City of New York demonstrates, an 1811 map turned an island into a city that works and walks.
abstract: Michael Kimmelman Critic's Notebook on exhibit at Museum of the City of New York celebrating the 200th anniversary of Manhattan's 1811 master plan, which laid out the borough's streets in a grid pattern, a landmark in urban history; holds that the exhibition is an object lesson in how aggressive and socially responsible leadership could tackle New York's 21st century problems.
lead_paragraph: As “The Greatest Grid: The Master Plan of Manhattan, 1811-2011” at the Museum of the City of New York demonstrates, an 1811 map turned an island into a city that works and walks.

headline.seo: Manhattan Street Grid at Museum of City of New York
headline.main: The Grid at 200: Lines That Shaped Manhattan
